title: Transient Treatment of Human Pluripotent Stem Cells with DMSO to Promote Differentiation
procedures:
1. Stem Cell Maintenance
NOTE: The cell maintenance protocol described below applies to pluipotent stem cells (PSCs) maintained in an adherent monolayer. Media, other reagents, and cell culture plates used prior to DMSO treatment can be adjusted as needed. For all the following protocols in this manuscript, cells should be handled under a biological safety cabinet.
Coat sterile, 6 well, tissue culture-treated plates with a pluripotent stem cell-qualified matrix or substrate prepared per the manufacturer’s instructions and incubate for at least 1 h in a CO2 incubator (5% CO2, humid atmosphere). Coated plates can be film wrapped and stored at 4 °C for up to one week.
Thaw the cryopreserved PSCs in a 37 °C water bath. Sterilize vial with ethanol prior to introduction to the biological safety cabinet, then immediately transfer the cells by pipetting to a sterile conical tube containing 5-10 volumes of prewarmed stem cell media.
Centrifuge the cells at 300 x g for 5 min at room temperature (RT).
Aspirate the media and gently resuspend the cell pellet in 1 mL of stem cell media supplemented with a 10 µM ROCK inhibitor, such as Y-27632.
Aspirate the culture matrix from the plate and seed the cells at the desired density, typically 0.5-1 x 106 cells per well in at least 2 mL of stem cell media per well.
NOTE: The plating density can vary across different cell lines, and clones and should be optimized accordingly.
Maintain the cells by replacing with prewarmed stem cell media daily. Split the cells at roughly 70%-80% confluency or when the cell colonies begin to make contact.
For splitting cells, aspirate the media and wash the cells once with sterile PBS. Incubate the cells with 1 mL of a dissociation enzyme solution per well for 5-10 minutes at 37 °C.

Wash and resuspend the cells with prewarmed stem cell media and transfer to a sterile conical tube with 5-10 volumes of stem cell media. Follow steps 1.3-1.7 to plate the cells.
2. DMSO Pretreatment
NOTE: When plating the cells for DMSO pretreatment prior to differentiation, the starting plating cell density should be optimized with consideration of the typical growth rate of the stem cell line as well as the differentiation protocol being used. Validate pluripotency using conventional markers, as necessary. Cells should be passaged at least 1x-2x after initial thawing prior to differentiation.
2D culture differentiation
When the cells reach an appropriate confluency, prepare coated plates, dissociate the cells, and prepare a single-cell suspension as described above.
Count the live cells using a hemocytometer or automatic cell counter including trypan blue or another viability marker.
Plate the cells onto a coated 6 well plate at 0.5-1 x 106 cells per well in stem cell media with the 10 µM ROCK inhibitor.
NOTE: For the cell lines tested in our laboratory, these densities typically resulted in 80%-90% confluent cells within the 24 h DMSO pretreatment.
Allow cells to incubate for 24 h at 37 °C in a CO2 incubator (5% CO2, humid atmosphere).
Prepare 1%-2% DMSO in prewarmed stem cell media (e.g., 100 µL of DMSO in 10 mL of media = 1% DMSO solution, or 200 µL DMSO in 10 mL of media = 2% DMSO solution).
After 24 h incubation, aspirate the media from cells and replace it with DMSO solution.
Allow the cells to incubate for 24 h to 48 h at 37 °C in a CO2 incubator (5% CO2, humid atmosphere) prior to differentiation.

NOTE: Typically, a 24 h DMSO treatment is sufficient across a majority of human ESC and iPSC lines. Cell lines with very slow growth rates (long doubling times) can benefit from the 48 h incubation with DMSO. For a 48 h incubation with DMSO, media can be replaced with fresh stem cell media with 1%-2% DMSO after the first 24 h of treatment.
3D culture differentiation:
When the cells reach an appropriate confluency, dissociate and collect the cells in a cell suspension as described above.
Count the live cells using a hemocytometer or automatic cell counter including a viability marker.
Plate the cells in an uncoated, low-attachment 6 well plate at 0.5-1 x 106 cells per well in stem cell media with 10 µM ROCK inhibitor.
NOTE: For the cell lines tested in our laboratory, these densities typically resulted in 3D hPSC sphere formation within 24 h of setting cells.
Allow cells to incubate for 24 h at 37 °C in a CO2 incubator (5% CO2, humid atmosphere).
Prepare 1%-2% DMSO in prewarmed stem cell media (e.g., 100 µL of DMSO in 10 mL of media = 1% DMSO solution, or 200 µL of DMSO in 10 mL of media = 2% DMSO solution).
Replace the media following standard procedures (e.g., tilt the plate at a 30°-45° angle to allow cell spheres to settle at the bottom of the well; transfer cells to a sterile conical tube and allow cell spheres to settle at the bottom of the tube; or gently collect cells in suspension using a 5 or 10 mL pipette into a sterile conical tube and centrifuge cells at 300 x g for 5 min at RT).
Aspirate the media from cells and replace it with DMSO solution, pipetting gently.

Allow cells to incubate for 24 h to 48 h at 37 °C in a CO2 incubator (5% CO2, humid atmosphere) prior to differentiation.
NOTE: Typically, a 24 h DMSO treatment is sufficient across a majority of human ESC and iPSC lines. Cell lines with very slow growth rates (long doubling times) can benefit from the 48 h incubation with DMSO. For a 48 h incubation with DMSO, media can be replaced with fresh stem cell media with 1%-2% DMSO after the first 24 h of treatment.
3. Differentiation to Primary Germ Layers
NOTE: The following describes methods previously shown to be effective in our laboratory for PSCs grown in a monolayer on 6 well plates. Any differentiation protocol of choice should be used after the DMSO treatment to promote differentiation into desired lineages. Remove DMSO solution after a 24-48 h treatment and proceed with differentiation following standard protocols.
Endoderm differentiation (adapted from Kroon et al.30)
	
Pretreat cells with DMSO as described above for 2D cultures.
Prepare Wnt3a and Activin A stock solutions.
Prepare Day 1 endodermal differentiation media by adding Wnt3a to a final concentration of 20 ng/mL and Activin A to a final concentration of 100 ng/mL to the appropriate volume of prewarmed RPMI media.
After DMSO pretreatment, aspirate media from the cells and replace it with Day 1 media (e.g., 2 mL per well of a 6 well plate).
Allow cells to incubate for 24 h at 37 °C in a CO2 incubator (5% CO2, humid atmosphere).
Prepare Days 2 and 3 endodermal differentiation media by adding Activin A to a final concentration of 100 ng/mL to the appropriate volume of prewarmed RPMI media.
Aspirate media from the cells and replace it with Day 2 media (e.g., 2 mL per well of a 6 well plate).

Allow the cells to incubate for 24 h at 37 °C in a CO2 incubator (5% CO2, humid atmosphere).
Aspirate media from the cells and replace with Day 3 media (e.g., 2 mL per well of a 6 well plate).
Mesoderm differentiation (adapted from Zhang et al.31)
	
Pretreat the cells with DMSO as described above for 2D cultures.
Prepare Wnt3a and Activin A stock solutions.
Prepare mesodermal differentiation media by adding Wnt3a to a final concentration of 20 ng/mL and Activin A to a final concentration of 100 ng/mL to the appropriate volume of prewarmed advanced RPMI media.
After DMSO pretreatment, aspirate media from cells and replace with differentiation media (e.g., 2 mL per well of a 6 well plate).
Allow cells to incubate for 24 h at 37 °C in a CO2 incubator (5% CO2, humid atmosphere).
Ectoderm differentiation (adapted from Chambers et al.32)
	
Pretreat the cells with DMSO as described above for 2D cultures.
Prepare Noggin and SB431542 stock solutions.
Prepare ectodermal differentiation base media by dissolving knockout serum replacement (KOSR) to a final concentration of 10% in knockout DMEM.
NOTE: Prepare enough base media for 3-4 days of media change.
Prepare ectodermal differentiation media by adding Noggin to a final concentration of 500 ng/mL and SB431542 to a final concentration of 10 µM to the appropriate volume of prewarmed KOSR/knockout DMEM.
After DMSO pretreatment, aspirate media from cells and replace with differentiation media (e.g., 2 mL per well of a 6 well plate).
Allow cells to incubate for 3-4 days at 37 °C in a CO2 incubator (5% CO2, humid atmosphere), replacing media daily with freshly added differentiation factors.
4. Differentiation to Progenitor Cell Types

The following describes methods previously shown to be effective in our laboratory for PSCs grown in a 2D or 3D cultures. Any differentiation protocol of choice should be used after the DMSO treatment to promote differentiation into desired lineages. Remove DMSO solution after a 24-48 h treatment and proceed with differentiation following standard protocols.
Neural progenitor cell differentiation (adapted from Tchieu et al.33)
	
Prepare 6 well plates by coating with a pluripotent stem cell-qualified reduced growth factor matrix or substrate, per the manufacturer’s instructions, for at least 1 h in a CO2 incubator (5% CO2, humid atmosphere). Coated plates can be film wrapped and stored at 4 °C for up to 1 week.
Plate PSCs as described above at density of 0.5-1 x 106 cells per well in stem cell media containing a ROCK inhibitor.
Pretreat cells with DMSO as described above for 2D cultures.
Prepare small chemical inhibitors LDN193189, SB431542, and XAV939 stock solutions.
Prepare Days 1-3 neuroectoderm differentiation media by supplementing Essential 6 Media with 500 nM LDN193189, 10 µM SB431542, and 2 µM XAV939.
After DMSO pretreatment, aspirate the media and replace with Days 1-3 neuroectoderm media (e.g., 2 mL per well of a 6 well plate). Change media daily.
Prepare Days 4-12 neuroectoderm differentiation media by supplementing Essential 6 Media with 500 nM LDN193189 and 10 µM SB431542.
On day 4 of differentiation, aspirate the media and replace with Days 4-12 neurodectoderm media. Change the media daily.
After 12 days of differentiation, differentiated cells should express appropriate markers of neural progenitor cells (NPCs). NPCs can be further maintained in neural media containing DMEM/F-12, 2% B-27, 1% N-2, and supplemented with 10 µg/mL basic fibroblast growth factor (bFGF). Passage the NPCs when confluent using a cell detachment solution, plating NPCs at 0.5-1 x 106 cells per well.

Oligodendrocyte progenitor cell differentiation (adapted from Douvaras and Fossati34)
	
Plate the PSCs as described above at a density of 1 x 105 per well on coated 6 well plates in stem cell media containing a ROCK inhibitor.
Pretreat cells with DMSO as described above for 2D cultures.
Prepare SB431542, LDN193189, all-trans retinoic acid (RA), and smoothened agonist (SAG) stock solutions.
Prepare Days 0–8 differentiation media by supplementing DMEM/F-12 with 10 μM SB431542, 250 nM LDN193189, and 100 nM RA.
After DMSO pretreatment, incubate cells with differentiation media for 8 days, changing media daily with freshly added differentiation factors (e.g., 2 mL per well of a 6 well plate).
On day 8, replace media with DMEM/F-12 containing 1x MEM non-essential amino acids (NEAA) solution, 1X L-glutamine, 2-mercaptoethanol, penicillin/streptomycin, and 1x N-2 supplemented 100 nM RA and 1 µM SAG. Change the media daily.
After 12 days of differentiation, differentiated cells should express appropriate markers of oligodendrocyte progenitor cells (OPCs).
Endocrine progenitor cell differentiation (adapted from Pagliuca et al.35)
	
Seed PSCs at 6 x 105 cells/mL in stem cell media plus 10 µM ROCK inhibitor in 500 mL spinner flasks placed on a 9-position stir plate set at rotation rate of 70 rpm in a 37 °C incubator, 5% CO2, and 100% humidity.
Allow clusters to settle at the bottom of the flask, aspirate the media, then pretreat with 1%-2% DMSO.
Prepare Activin A, Chir99021, KGF, Sant1, all-trans retinoic acid (RA), LDN193189, PdBU, XXI, Alk51, T3, and Betacelluin stock solutions.
Prepare differentiation base media based on formulation in Table 3.
After DMSO pretreatment, aspirate media and replace with S1 media supplemented with 100 ng/mL Activin A and 3 mM Chir99021 (e.g., 500 mL per flask). Allow incubation for 24 h.

On day 2, replace media with S1 media supplemented with 100 ng/mL Activin A. Allow incubation for 2 days.
On day 4, replace media with S2 media supplemented with 50 ng/mL KGF. Allow incubation for 3 days, changing media after the first 2 days (Day 6).
On day 7, replace media with S3 media supplemented with 50 ng/mL KGF, 0.25 mM Sant1, 2 mM RA, and 200 nM LDN193189. Allow incubation for 24 h.
On day 8, replace media with S3 media supplemented with 50 ng/mL KGF, 0.25 mM Sant1, 2 mM RA, 200 nM LDN193189, and 500 nM PdBU. Allow incubation for 24 h.
On day 9, replace media with S3 media supplemented with 50 ng/mL KGF, 0.25 mM Sant1, and 100 nM RA. Allow incubation for 5 days, changing media every 2 days (day 11 and 13).
On days 14 and 16, replace media with S5 media supplemented with 0.25 mM Sant1, 100 nM RA, 1 mM XXI, 10 mM Alk5i II, 1 mM T3, and 20 ng/mL betacellulin (4 days total incubation).
On days 18 and 20, replace media with S5 media supplemented with 25 nM RA, 1 mM XXI, 10 mM Alk5i II, 1 mM T3, and 20 ng/mL betacellulin.
5. Immunocytochemical Validation of Differentiation
NOTE: The following methods describes a general immunocytochemical protocol that can be adjusted as needed. Primary antibodies are those that have been previously validated in our laboratory. Other techniques for validation of differentiation can also be used (e.g., flow cytometry, qPCR, RNA sequencing, western blotting, functional assays, etc.).
Immunolabeling cells
For 3D cultures in suspension, plate whole cell clusters or clusters dispersed into single-cell suspension onto coated plates for 18-24 h prior to fixation.
Aspirate media from adherent cells and wash briefly with PBS at RT on a shaker.

For cell fixation, aspirate PBS and incubate cells with 4% paraformaldehyde (PFA) in PBS for 20 min at RT on shaker.
CAUTION: PFA stock should be prepared under a fume hood due to its toxicity. Do not inhale and wear proper personal protective equipment.
Remove PFA and discard in the proper chemical waste container.
Wash cells 3x with PBS for at least 5 min per wash at RT on a shaker.
For cell permeabilization and blocking, incubate cells with 5% donkey serum prepared in 0.3% triton-x 100/PBS for 1 h at RT on a shaker.
Prepare primary antibody solution in the same solution used for permeabilization/blocking.
Incubate in primary antibody solution overnight at 4 °C on shaker.
After overnight incubation, wash cells 3x with PBS for at least 5 min per wash at RT on a shaker.
Prepare secondary antibody solution in permeabilization/blocking solution.
Allow to incubate in secondary antibody solution for 1 h at RT on a shaker.
Aspirate secondary antibody solution and wash cells 3x with PBS for at least 5 min per wash at RT on a shaker.
Incubate cells with DAPI or another preferred marker for appropriate incubation time, and rinse in PBS.
Image quantification
Acquire a minimum of three images per condition on a fluorescent microscope and/or with a high content screening platform.
Quantify the percent of positive cells for each marker by counting the total number of antibody stained cells and total cell numbers (based on DAPI/Hoechst nuclei staining) using unbiased imaging software (e.g., ImageJ) or an automated screening platform for analyses.
